page.title: 12ECOLOGY
page.content: There are several patches of woodland, some privately owned, other maintained by the local council. Of the latter category is{Hart's Wood,}an area of broad-leaved trees sensitively managed. Of many species Oak is common throughout (many trees being about 100 years old), as is Silver Birch. Sweet Chestnuts grow in groups, while Beech and Ash are more scarce. There are some Hornbeams, long ago pollarded, while Rowan and Holly are abundant at lower levels. Bracken and Bramble provide much ground-cover. Among mammals, Grey Squirrel and Badger inhabit the wood.{Shenfield Common}has been colonized by trees only since "navvies" dug the railway cutting in 1840's, leaving uneven ground known as "The Tips". Thiftwood has a similar mixture of deciduous trees, but is owned by the Scouting Association.
